section1.title: Purpose of This Site
section1.content: 'Web Roulette' was developed to provide a custom roulette creation tool that anyone can use easily and intuitively. We aim to help you make fair choices while having fun in various situations, from small daily decisions to event lotteries.

section2.title: Target Audience
section2.content: It is intended for a wide range of users, from personal use to business and educational purposes, such as deciding on a lunch spot with friends, drawing penalty games for live streamers, selecting students in the classroom, or choosing winners for online events.

section3.content: We sincerely welcome your feedback. We will use it as a reference for future development, so please feel free to contact us via the contact page.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Find answers to common questions about Web Roulette. If you can't find the answer you're looking for, feel free to contact us.

questions.q: Is Web Roulette free to use?
questions.a: Yes, all basic features of Web Roulette are completely free to use. You can create, spin, and share roulettes without any charge. Advanced features like saving roulettes require a free user account.

questions.q: Do I need to register to create a roulette?
questions.a: No, you can create and use a roulette without registering an account. However, if you want to save your created roulettes for later use, you will need to sign up for a free account.

questions.q: How can I share my roulette?
questions.a: You can easily share your roulette by generating a unique URL or by downloading it as an image. Look for the 'Share' button on the roulette creation page.

questions.q: Can I customize the probabilities of the items?
questions.a: Yes, you can set a 'ratio' for each item in the roulette settings. A higher ratio increases the probability of that item being selected.

Users can disable the use of cookies by changing their browser settings. If you select "Decline" on our cookie consent banner, no information will be collected on this site. create.title: How to create a roulette (add/delete items, change ratios/colors)
create.description: Learn how to create your own original roulette by freely setting items, colors, and ratios.
create.interactiveDescription: Let's learn how to create a roulette by actually operating the panel below. You can freely change item names, colors, ratios, and more.

step1.title: Step 1: Basic Roulette Settings
step1.content: First, enter the 'Title' and 'Description' for your roulette. The title helps distinguish it from other roulettes, and the description is useful for explaining its purpose. Set them up to be clear for others.

step2.title: Step 2: Adding and Customizing Items
step2.content: Next, use the 'Add Item' button to add options to the roulette. For each item, you can freely set its display 'Name' and an identifying 'Color'. You can intuitively pick colors from the color picker.

step3.title: Step 3: Setting the Winning Ratio
step3.content: You can set a 'Ratio' for each item. This is a number that indicates how likely that item is to be selected. For example, if you set 'A: 2, B: 1', A will be twice as likely to be chosen as B. If you want all items to have the same probability, enter the same number for all.

step4.title: Step 4: Finishing Setup
step4.content: Once you've configured all the items, your original roulette is complete! Check it in the preview and you can start the draw anytime with the 'Spin' button.

spin.title: How to spin the roulette
spin.description: Explains the procedure for spinning the created roulette and checking the lottery results.

step1.title: Step 1: Spin the Roulette
step1.content: The roulette you created and configured is displayed in the preview area. When you click the 'Spin' button in the center, the roulette will start to spin vigorously.

step2.title: Step 2: Check the Result
step2.content: When the rotation stops, the selected item is highlighted, and the result is displayed prominently in the center of the screen. A fun confetti animation will liven up the moment of the draw!

step3.title: Step 3: Try Again
step3.content: If you want to spin the roulette again with the same settings, just click the 'Spin Again' button on the result screen. You can start the next draw right away.

share.title: How to share results (URL/Image)
share.description: Learn how to share your roulette results with friends or on social media via URL or as an image.

step1.title: Step 1: Select a Sharing Option
step1.content: After spinning the roulette, you can share it from the result screen or the 'Share' button on the settings screen. You can choose between two sharing options: 'Share via URL' and 'Share as Image'.

step2.title: Step 2: Sharing via URL
step2.content: When you select 'Share via URL', the URL of the page reflecting the current roulette settings (results not included) is copied to your clipboard. Paste this URL to friends or on social media, and anyone can experience the same roulette.

step3.title: Step 3: Sharing as an Image
step3.content: When you select 'Share as Image', the current look of the roulette is downloaded as an image file (PNG format). This is useful for announcing event results or for sharing visually.

merit.title: Benefits of account registration (data saving, etc.)
merit.description: Discover the convenient features that become available when you register for a free account.

benefit1.title: Benefit 1: Save and Reuse Roulettes
benefit1.content: When you create an account, you can save your created roulettes to 'My Page'. This saves you the trouble of recreating the same roulette every time, allowing you to call up and use your favorite settings at any time.

benefit2.title: Benefit 2: Sync Across Devices
benefit2.content: By logging in, you can access your saved roulettes from any device. For example, you can use a roulette created on your PC at home from your smartphone on the go.

benefit3.title: Benefit 3: Publish as a Template
benefit3.content: You can publish your masterpiece roulettes as 'templates' that other users can also use. Your ideas might be helpful to someone around the world. You can change the publication settings at any time.

auth.title: Steps for new registration and login
auth.description: Explains how to create a new account and the steps for logging in after registration.

step1.title: Step 1: How to Sign Up
step1.content: Proceed to the account creation page from the 'Sign Up' button in the header menu. The only required information is 'Username', 'Email Address', and 'Password'. After entering, click the button to complete the registration.

step2.title: Step 2: How to Log In
step2.content: Once you have created an account, log in from the 'Login' page by entering your registered email address and password. Your login state will be maintained, so there is no need to enter it every time.

step3.title: Step 3: Social Login
step3.content: As an easier login method, we also support social login using a Google account. Just click the 'Login with Google' button to start using the service immediately without any tedious input.

mypage.title: My Page: Manage created roulettes (edit/delete), and edit your profile.
mypage.description: Explains how to manage your saved roulettes on the dedicated My Page for logged-in users.

step1.title: Step 1: Accessing My Page
step1.content: While logged in, click on your username in the header menu or the 'My Page' link to go to your dedicated page.

step2.title: Step 2: Managing Roulettes
step2.content: On My Page, all the roulettes you have saved are displayed in a list. From here, you can change the settings with the 'Edit' button for each roulette, or delete unnecessary ones with the 'Delete' button.

step3.title: Step 3: Public Settings and Profile
step3.content: By changing the 'Public Settings' for each roulette, you can publish it as a template that other users can use. You can also set up your public profile information from 'Edit Profile' to let other users know who created the template.

templates.title: Template Feature: How to use templates and set your own roulettes to public.
templates.description: Learn how to find and use templates created by other users, and how to publish your own roulettes as templates.

step1.title: Step 1: Find a Template
step1.content: On the 'Find from Templates' page, various roulettes created by other users are published. Find interesting templates by searching with keywords or sorting by newest or most popular.

step2.title: Step 2: Use a Template
step2.content: When you find a template you like, click the 'Use this Template' button. This will open a new roulette creation screen with all the settings of that template (items, colors, ratios, etc.) inherited. All you have to do is customize it freely.

step3.title: Step 3: Publish a Template
step3.content: To publish your own roulette as a template, first go to My Page. In the 'Public Settings' of the roulette you want to publish, turn on 'Publish as Template', and other users will be able to use your roulette.

originalRoulette.title: How to use Original Roulette
originalRoulette.description: Learn the steps to create your very own completely original roulette. Shape your ideas from scratch, without being tied to other templates.

step1.title: Step 1: Starting from Scratch
step1.content: The greatest feature of the original roulette function is the ability to create your own roulette from a completely blank state, without relying on existing templates. First, decide on a title and description for your roulette on the creation page and take the first step of your idea.

step2.title: Step 2: Freely Configure Items
step2.content: You can add as many options as you like with the 'Add Item' button. Give each item a unique name and set your favorite color with the color picker to aim for a visually fun roulette.

step3.title: Step 3: Manipulate Probability with Ratios
step3.content: By adjusting the 'Ratio' of each item, you can finely control the winning probability. Design the lottery logic as you wish, such as making a specific item more likely to win, or making all items equal.

step4.title: Step 4: Save and Share
step4.content: If you are logged into your account, you can record the completed roulette on My Page with the 'Save' button. You can also use the 'Share' function to broadcast your unique roulette to the world via URL or image.
